meanings.sent1: They decided to formalize their agreement by signing a contract.
meanings.sent2: The company needed to formalize the new policy before implementing it.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see them formalize their friendship with a secret handshake.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to formalize his emotions into a masterpiece on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a certificate to formalize the student's achievement.

meanings.definition: To give a definite or organized structure to
meanings.sent1: She wanted to formalize her schedule by adding specific time slots for each task.
meanings.sent2: The architect needed to formalize the design plans before construction could begin.
meanings.sent3: The chaos of the room made her want to formalize it into a neat and tidy space.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts began to formalize into a clear plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: The recipe helped her formalize the steps needed to bake a delicious cake.

meanings.definition: To make something conform to a set of rules or standards
meanings.sent1: The school had to formalize its dress code to ensure students followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: He needed to formalize his resume to meet the industry standards.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious teenager found it hard to formalize his behavior to fit in with the school's expectations.
meanings.sent4: The software developer had to formalize the code to meet the programming standards.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to formalize their presentation to meet the client's requirements.
